posts.cooked:
While re-inaging our roboRIO 2.0, the battery on our robot died part way through.

And since that we haven‚Äôt been able to reimage the Rio, I‚Äôm wondering how it might be able to fix this, or possibly reimage the micro SD card directly.

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: You could try flashing the sd card with balenaetcher, which should work since that‚Äôs the only user accessible flash memory. Im not entirely certain that this would fix it but it‚Äôs worth a try.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked:
The NI roboRIO 2.0 boots from a microSD card configured with an appropriate boot image containing the NI Linux Real-Time OS, drivers, and libraries specific to FRC. There are two ways to create the...

There are instructions for flashing the SD card. I‚Äôd usually recommend doing that over the imaging tool, as it‚Äôs a lot faster and often more reliable too.

And on a Rio 2, flashing the SD card reimages everything, so should definitely come back from the bad state.

link_counts.title: roboRIO 2.0 microSD Card Imaging ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: Yeah, we tried reimaging multiple times, but each time it said it couldn‚Äôt download the image to the Rio.
Thanks, I can try that tomorrow.

posts.name: Newton Crosby Jr
posts.cooked: Have you run the imaging tool as an administrator? It‚Äôs a dumb question but it took my 5 unsuccessful flashes over 20 minutes to figure that out, and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one who‚Äôs done that.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Now availible on DVD and Blu-Ray!

posts.custom_user_title: Now availible on DVD and Blu-Ray!

posts.cooked: Yeah, ran it as administrator, booted the Rio in safe mode, fully reinstalled, and used multiple laptops.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: The USB stick recovery procedure isn‚Äôt applicable to the roboRIO 2

So we got it sorted out, when using balena etcher we still had problems, but when imaging it through terminal on one of our mentors laptops running Linux, we were able to get it to image successfully.
